item.title: Bulletin updated at 12:02 HKT 09/09/2021
item.description:
At noon at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 32 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 65 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 3
Intensity of UV radiation : moderate

According to the latest forecast, the track of Tropical Cyclone Conson is expected to be further away from Hong Kong in the next couple of days, and the impact on the local winds will be lower than previously expected. The chance of issuing the Standby Signal, No. 1 will also be lower. However, members of the public shall note that there will be swells in the next few days. Tropical Cyclone Chanthu is expected to move towards Taiwan and Luzon Strait in the next couple of days. Its associated subsiding air will bring very hot weather to southern China. High temperatures will also trigger showers and squally thunderstorms. The Observatory will continue to closely monitor the movement of the two tropical cyclones. Members of the public should take note of the latest weather bulletins.

Please be reminded that:
The Very Hot Weather Warning is now in force. The public should beware of heatstroke and drink more water.
